corpusDir.memo: The directory that stores the txt files

includeFileTypes.memo: Filter files by extension names (separate by comma). If not filter defined, all files will be read

filePath.memo: The excel file that store the txt data

sheetName.memo: The excel sheet name that you want to import. Default is Sheet1

docNameColumnPos.memo: The position of document name column (A is 1, B is 2...)

docTxtColumnPos.memo: The position of document text column (A is 1, B is 2...)

docDateColumnPos.memo: The position of document date column (A is 1, B is 2... if don't have a date column, leave it as -1)

startRowNum.memo: Start to import from row #(you need to skip header columns, if there is any)

annotations.memo: support Brat and eHOST format, the format will be automatically detected.

projectDir.memo: the directory that hosts the eHOST project

overWriteAnnotatorName.memo: if a name is set, all the annotations' annotator will be overwritten by this name

exportDir.memo: the directory to export the rule files

ViewImportedDocs.memo: View the imported files in database

ImportAnnotations.memo: Import annotations into the output table

ViewImportedAnnotations.memo: View the imported annotations in database

RuleFileOrStr.memo: Infer annotation types based on modifiers
Infer sentence types based on the mention level annotations

WriteConcepts.memo: The names of the concepts that need to be written to db(separated by , or ;)

report.memo: whether report the processing details at the end

targetAnnotator.memo: Compare annotations from annotator (leave it blank will use easycie's current annotator as default)

targetRunId.memo: run id of target annotator. Default is the latest run id when leave blank

referenceRunId.memo: run id of reference annotator. Default is the latest run id when leave blank

typeFilter.memo: limit the comparison to a certain type

Compare.memo: Compare the difference between two annotators

RuSH.memo: display types of RuSH (sentence segmentor and tokenizer) output

FastNER.memo: display types of RuSH (sentence segmentor and tokenizer) output

FastContext.memo: display types of RuSH (sentence segmentor and tokenizer) output

TemporalContext.memo: display types of RuSH (sentence segmentor and tokenizer) output

FeatureInferencer.memo: display types of RuSH (sentence segmentor and tokenizer) output

SentenceInferencer.memo: display types of RuSH (sentence segmentor and tokenizer) output

ShowUimaViewer.memo: if true then display UIMA annotation viewer after execution

RefreshDebugPipe.memo: After change the configuration files, you need manually refresh the pipeline

ehost.memo: the directory to save the exported ehost files

brat.memo: the directory to save the exported brat files

uima.memo: the directory to save the exported uima xmi files

exportTypes.memo: If specified, then only these types will be displayed(separate by comma). If not, only Concepts will be saved. To save document conclusion, add type Doc_BASE

directory.memo: The dirctory to save the exported excel files

sampleSize.memo: If >0, then easyCIE will randomly sample the defined number of documents

ExportEhost.memo: Run Preannotator and export the annotation to eHOST format

OpenEhost.memo: Open ehost to view the exported annotations

dbFile.memo: the db file(or configuration file) used to saved the txt corpus

table.memo: the table used to saved the txt corpus

datasetId.memo: data set id (Default is '0'. Use to differentiate different dataset in the same table.)

overwrite.memo: if the table exist, whether overwrite it

dbFile.memo: the db file(or configuration file) used to saved the outputs

snippetResultTable.memo: the table used to saved the annotations

docResultTable.memo: the table used to saved the annotations

bunchResultTable.memo: the table used to saved the annotations

compareTable.memo: the table used to saved the annotations

viewer.preTag: <html><head> <script> function scrollToId() { var elmnt = document.getElementById("highlighter"); elmnt.scrollIntoView(); } </script> </head><body onload='scrollToId()' style="margin: 0; padding: 0"> <div id="mydiv">

highlighter_begin.memo: Set default color to FFFFF, then the viewer will pick one from the color pool below.

random_pick_color.memo: whether randomly pick a color from the color pool below or pick in order

width.memo: The column width in view table
